author: By Manohla Dargis
title: At Sundance, a Glorious Diversity of Voices Breaks Through
description: Onscreen at this year’s festival, you could find poetry, tragedy, comedy and, most important, the range of lived experiences around the world.
content: PARK CITY, Utah — A runaway bride, wildly rambunctious women and two quietly resolute girls — the Sundance Film Festival is one movie celebration where the so-called second sex consistently comes out on top. Now in its 36th year, the festival has long made room for female filmmakers even when there weren’t all that many. In 1985, its inaugural year, it presented 85 movies, 10 from female directors, about half non-Americans like Lina Wertmüller, one of the few such filmmakers on anyone’s radar back then. Of this year’s 128 features, nearly half are from women. (The festival ends Sunday.)
source.name: The New York Times

title: Sichuan That Moves Beyond Spiciness at Chuan Tian Xia
description: At this Sunset Park, Brooklyn, restaurant, mala — the province’s distinct marriage of numbing force and feral heat — is only one shade of the meal.
content: Yu xiang qie zi is fish-fragrant eggplant, which has no fish. It is simply, grandly, eggplant treated like fish, cooked with paojiao — chiles pickled but still bright — and doubanjiang, a paste of broad beans left to ferment for months, then dosed with chiles and fermented some more. Ginger brings sweetness, vinegar the sourness of time.
